skill.name: competitive-ads-extractor
skill.description: Extracts and analyzes competitors' ads from ad libraries (Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.) to understand what messaging, problems, and creative approaches are working. Helps inspire and improve your own ad campaigns.
skill.summary: Extracts and analyzes competitors' ads from ad libraries (Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.) to understand wh...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only documentation and example prompts. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. The skill provides guidance for using public ad libraries (Facebook Ad Library, LinkedIn) for competitive research - a legitimate marketing intelligence activity.

content.user_title: Research competitor ad strategies from ad libraries
content.value_statement: Manually researching competitor ads takes hours of tedious work. This skill provides structured prompts to extract and analyze ads from Facebook Ad Library, LinkedIn, and other public sources, identifying successful messaging patterns and creative approaches you can adapt.
actual_capabilities: Extract competitor ads from Facebook Ad Library and LinkedIn
Analyze messaging patterns, problems highlighted, and value propositions
Identify successful creative patterns and visual approaches
Categorize ads by theme, audience, or format
Compare multiple competitors and platforms side by side
Generate actionable insights for your own ad campaigns
limitations: Does not automatically scrape websites - relies on user following prompts to access public ad libraries
Cannot access private or restricted ad data
Does not provide engagement metrics or performance data from ad platforms
Analysis quality depends on the input and user judgment

use_cases.title: Research competitor ad strategies
use_cases.description: Analyze what messaging and creative approaches competitors use to inform your campaign planning.

use_cases.title: Discover positioning gaps
use_cases.description: Find underserved pain points and messaging angles competitors are missing.

use_cases.title: Generate creative inspiration
use_cases.description: Build a library of successful ad patterns to inspire original creative work for clients.

prompt_templates.title: Basic ad extraction
prompt_templates.scenario: Extract ads from a single competitor
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all current ads from [Competitor Name] on Facebook Ad Library and analyze what messaging is working for them.

prompt_templates.title: Problem-focused analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Get ads from [Competitor] focusing on their messaging about [specific problem]. What pain points are they highlighting?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-competitor comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract ads from these 5 competitors: [list]. Compare their approaches and tell me what's working across the market.

prompt_templates.title: Platform-specific research
prompt_templates.prompt: Get LinkedIn ads from [Competitor] and analyze their B2B positioning strategy and messaging approach.

output_examples.input: Extract ads from Notion on Facebook Ad Library and tell me what messaging is working for them.

best_practices: Use for research and inspiration only - do not copy competitor ads directly
Save ads regularly to track how messaging evolves over time
Compare multiple platforms since Facebook and LinkedIn often have different messaging approaches
anti_patterns: Plagiarizing competitor copy or stealing visual designs
Assuming frequency equals success - more ads does not always mean better performance
Ignoring your own brand positioning in favor of copying competitor approaches

faq.question: Which ad libraries can I research?
faq.answer: This skill works with Facebook Ad Library, LinkedIn Ad Library, and other public transparency tools. You can also adapt prompts for TikTok and Google Ads transparency pages.

faq.question: Does this skill scrape ads automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides structured prompts you use to guide Claude in analyzing ads you access. You manually access the ad libraries and share findings with Claude.

faq.question: Can I get engagement metrics?
faq.answer: Public ad libraries show ads but not engagement numbers. The skill focuses on analyzing messaging, creative approach, and positioning rather than performance data.

faq.question: Is this legal for commercial use?
faq.answer: Yes. Ad libraries are public transparency tools. Use insights for inspiration and strategy, but do not copy designs, images, or copy directly in your own campaigns.

faq.question: How many competitors can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: The skill works with single competitors, small competitor sets, or industry-wide analysis. For large-scale research, break it into multiple sessions for better organization.

faq.question: How does this differ from paid ad intelligence tools?
faq.answer: Paid tools provide automation and data metrics. This skill provides structured analysis methodology you can apply anywhere for free with any AI assistant.
